metadata.title: CVE-2017-18075 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
crypto/pcrypt.c in the Linux kernel before 4.14.13 mishandles freeinginstances, allowing a local user able to access the AF_ALG-based AEADinterface (CONFIG_CRYPTO_USER_API_AEAD) and pcrypt (CONFIG_CRYPTO_PCRYPT)to cause a denial of service (kfree of an incorrect pointer) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact by executing a crafted sequence of systemcalls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

No subscription required
